text: A heart valve normally allows blood to flow in only one direction through the heart. The four valves are commonly represented in a mammalian heart that determines the pathway of blood flow through the heart. A heart valve opens or closes incumbent on differential blood pressure on each side. ==References== ==Related pages== * Mitral Valve Repair at The Mount Sinai Hospital â€“ "Mitral Valve Anatomy" * 3D, animated, rotatable heart valves (Rich media including Javascript and Flash player required) * Transcatheter mitral valve implantation: Tendyne Category:Cardiovascular system Category:Heart Category:Anatomy of the cardiovascular system
title: Heart valve
